meanings.definition: A molding with a double curve, typically found in classical architecture.
meanings.sent1: The cyma added an elegant touch to the top of the building.
meanings.sent2: The ancient temple featured intricate cyma designs along its columns.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the cyma of the old building.
meanings.sent4: Her smile had a cyma-like grace, curving up at the corners.
meanings.sent5: The cyma stood out against the plain walls, drawing everyone's gaze.

meanings.definition: A type of seaweed commonly used in Asian cuisine.
meanings.sent1: The sushi chef carefully placed a strip of cyma on top of the rice.
meanings.sent2: The miso soup was garnished with delicate cyma strands.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they pretended to eat the cyma like noodles.
meanings.sent4: The cyma danced in the ocean currents, swaying gently with the tide.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the simmering broth mingled with the salty scent of the cyma.
